rom.name: BS Zelda no Densetsu - Adventuras de Pikachu - Map Two (Hack).smc

game.name: 521 - Super Mario World (USA)
game.info: This is my Super Mario World hack which consists of ten levels. Expect it to be harder than the original game but not as hard as some of the hacks out there.

game.name: 525 - Final Fantasy II (USA)
game.info: Sing is a useful and yet mediocre command. Normally, Sing casts two useful spells (Sleep and Charm) which can be reproduced with Edward’s Harp attacks. It also casts one pathetic spell that’s mildly useful (Mute) that hurts the useful spells. In the worst case, it casts no spell… which is a wasteful option. Of course, it’s also worth noting that the “hidden” Frog Song spell is sung while Edward’s a Toad.

game.name: 526 - Final Fantasy II (USA)
game.info: Of the 4 monster summons in FF4, the Goblin/Imp summon outright stinks. This hack improves the summon by changing it to use the same damage behavior as the Antlion’s Counter attack and the SwordRat’s Needle attack. The change makes this summon extremely scalable and provides the best tribute to FF5’s Goblin Punch.

game.name: 536 - Super Mario RPG - Legend of the Seven Stars (USA)
game.description: Super Mario RPG - Legend of the Seven Stars (USA)
game.info: “The Bob-omb Mafia has welshed out on a deal with Bowser and it is up to Mario to retrieve five of Bowser’s shells from the bob-ombs. In this hack Mario–with the help of Mallow–must defeat a series of bosses including a large Thwomp, two clowns, and a forest witch, and defeat the diminutive mafia boss who is under the guard of two large bob-bombs and a vicious, bloodthirsty ant. There is also one puzzle room, as well as a few side-quests.”

patch.name: Super Mario RPG - Legend of the Seven Stars (USA).ips

rom.name: Super Mario RPG - Legend of the Seven Stars (USA).sfc

game.name: 537 - Mortal Kombat II (USA) (Rev 1)
game.info: This hack allows you to play as the Hidden Characters Smoke, Noob Saibot, and Jade. Includes built-in game codes to activate them. Apply the IPS to the US Version 1.1 ROM with no header. Check the ReadMe file for the codes to activate each character.

game.name: 541 - Terranigma (Europe)
game.info: This patch converts Terranigma from PAL to NTSC video format. Basically, it allows you to run the game at 60fps.

game.name: 58 - Super Mario World (USA)
game.info: A complete overhaul of SMW, replacing everything with GFX from SMB3. This hack is meant to be used as a base for other hacks.

game.name: 59 - Zombies Ate My Neighbors (USA)
game.info: A complete level hack of the classic game with 55 new levels in total.

game.name: 600 - Final Fantasy III (USA)
game.info: This patch was created by Yazoo for his French translation of Final Fantasy VI. It replaces the Final Fantasy III title logo and copyright/license text with the original from the Japanese version. It also removes the black and white splashscreen that was displayed before the title sequence. The opening credits have also been restored to the ones from the Japanese version: the translator position has been removed.

game.name: 601 - Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA)
game.description: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA)
game.info: The purpose of this hack was to take the same approach Nintendo took with Ocarina of Time: Master Quest. Numerous Zelda games have a second quest in one form or another, and the author felt that A Link to the Past deserved a similar treatment. The dungeons have detours, rearranged items, tougher enemies, and an intermediate difficulty level. However, an optional “Double Heart Damage” patch is included for those looking for a greater challenge.

patch.name: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA).ups

rom.name: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA).sfc

game.name: 604 - Super Mario All-Stars (USA)
game.info: Since I was sick of seeing grass in world 1-1 where bricks should be I put together a hack to change several of the graphics of SMB1 in Super Mario All-Stars. It changes them to graphics which are much closer to what they were in the 8-bit game. The backgrounds have not been touched. The ROM needs to be unheadered.

game.name: 605 - Ogre Battle - The March of the Black Queen (USA)
game.description: Ogre Battle - The March of the Black Queen (USA)
game.info: This mod makes the previously undervalued units useful and adds a new class to the witch line which she can promote to at level 15 then she can use an undead ring to become a sorceress. The mage now promotes with an undead staff. Many attacks have been changed to make the game more enjoyable. Vampyre now uses an evil ring attack, the top dragons have three area of effects from the back row, the Cockatris keeps the Gryphon’s gale and has the petrify up front. All top level beasts now have 4 front row attacks and their resistances have been increased. Giants and Golems now have a normal chain of promotion just like the other characters. Evil ones, Muses, Beast Masters, Dragoners, Dragon Masters and Tigermen all get an extra attack up front. All four lords have been improved. Generals and Dragoons have 3 back row attacks because they are g d heros man. The only reduction is to the Lich which has 2 for balance, he is still the most powerful character in game. The goal is to make any character good enough to be valuable at the end of the game. I tried not to adjust too many stats or change anything unnecessarily but only to improve the characters in need. Included is a reference guide with all the important stats.

patch.name: Ogre Battle - The March of the Black Queen (USA).ips

rom.name: Ogre Battle - The March of the Black Queen (USA).sfc

game.name: 608 - Brandish (USA)
game.info: This is a very simplistic hack that changes a few names to match the ones found in the Japanese version (”Varik” to “Ares”, “Alexis” to “Dela”, etc.). Dela’s cutscene/sprite data has NOT been changed yet, however.

game.name: 617 - Final Fantasy III (USA)
game.info: This new Final Fantasy VI hack makes quite a few changes to gameplay whilst leaving the original story intact.

game.name: 623 - Zombies Ate My Neighbors (USA)
game.info: Almost 10 years in the making, a complete hack/ unofficial sequel including 55 all new levels, new gameplay options, items, enemies and more!

game.name: 626 - Super Mario Kart (USA)
game.info: I’ve been a fan of Super Mario Kart since I first played it in the early/mid nineties. Late last year I happened upon a romhack called Super Mario Kart: Pro Edition and was very impressed at the quality (though I was humbled by its difficulty). It inspired me to start my own hack of the tracks, with a focus on maintaining the feel of the original game.

game.name: 639 - Super Mario Kart (USA)
game.info: Well the hack is complete at last. I make the tracks really hard and some tracks easy and they are complete different than the original I mean very different :) The tracks are fun but sometimes frustrating :S (but possible)

game.name: 649 - Ogre Battle - The March of the Black Queen (USA)
game.description: Ogre Battle - The March of the Black Queen (USA)
game.info: Contained are 4 patches to fix problems with Ogre Battle. The first is a patch to expand the rom size to 2 MB which must be applied in order to use the others. Included are magic, random drop and character size table fixes.

patch.name: Ogre Battle - The March of the Black Queen (USA).ips

rom.name: Ogre Battle - The March of the Black Queen (USA).sfc

game.name: 65 - Super Mario World (USA)
game.info: This is an exceptional remake of all 52 levels of Super Mario Bros: The Lost Levels with SMB Allstars(SMB3) style graphics.

game.name: 659 - Super Metroid (Japan, USA) (En,Ja)
game.info: Intro:

game.name: 66 - Super Mario World (USA)
game.info: This is an exceptional remake of all 32 levels of Super Mario Bros. 1, including the “Minus World”, and “World 36″, with SMB Allstars (SMB3) style graphics.

game.name: 662 - Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (Europe)
game.description: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (Europe)
game.info: This hack was originally called –Zelda Shards of Might–. It was made by Omega and SePH, But unfortunately it was bugged. Zelda didn’t appear in the guardhouse. This could be fixed, but the forest dungeon was heavily bugged. The game was unsolvable.

patch.name: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (Europe).ips

rom.name: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (Europe).sfc

game.name: 667 - Super Mario World (USA)
game.info: Mario is on vacation when he meets a strange Koopa. Afterwards, he enters a gray pipe…

game.name: 672 - Secret of Mana (USA)
game.info: This is a patch, made by Masterflow, for Secret of Mana. It changes the limit of items from 4 to 9, (like in Seiken Densetsu 3).

game.name: 675 - Super Mario World (USA)
game.info: This is an extremely hard somewhat puzzle based Super Mario World hack.

game.name: 679 - Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack)
game.description: Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack)
game.info: This is my Earthbound hack that I have worked on since 2006. This hack is a graphics, story, gameplay change hack. Read the readme for more information.

patch.name: Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack).ips

rom.name: Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack).smc

game.name: 695 - Ninjawarriors Again, The (Japan)
game.info: Tiny patch to replace the green “blood” with a nice red one ^_^

game.name: 699 - Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack)
game.description: Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack)
game.info: Colinbound Infina’s Invasion is a total conversion of the game, Earthbound. I have completely changed the plot and almost all of text. I have altered the main protagonists and antagonists along with many other characters. Colinbound also has new battle sprites, new items, new magic spells, all new windows colors and much more.

patch.name: Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack).ips

rom.name: Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack).smc

game.name: 701 - Final Fantasy III (USA) (Rev 1)
game.info: FINAL FANTASY III: ONCE AGAIN is a patch I’ve been working on for much of the year. Initially, my intentions for the patch were very humble and private, but the more I learned about the available tools, the broader my approach became, and the final result, I believe, is a more balanced game with an overall heightened challenge factor, and some more changes that fans should enjoy playing. I tried my best throughout the process to keep things close to the classic era Final Fantasy, so even though a lot is different, there’s nothing here that is totally inconceivable or anachronistic to a Final Fantasy game of 1994.

game.name: 703 - Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA)
game.description: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA)
game.info: Puzzledude started to remodel the original Zelda A Link to the Past game a long time ago. Unlike Goddess of Wisdom this is a modification, but despite that the dungeons are quite different to solve with a lot of new tricks and hidden objects. The star on the floor has many meanings in this game. Sometimes it will change the pits on the floor, but usually it means that something is hidden. In this case, lift or hammer everything. At one point it even serves as a switch for opening the door.

patch.name: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA).ips

rom.name: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA).sfc

game.name: 712 - Final Fantasy III (USA)
game.info: UPDATE FROM AUTHOR: This patch is outdated and has been replaced by the newer and more stable Overkill 32,000 patch. It is recommended you download that patch instead.

game.name: 715 - Super Mario RPG - Legend of the Seven Stars (USA)
game.description: Super Mario RPG - Legend of the Seven Stars (USA)
game.info: Super Mario RPG was never released in Europe until it’s virtual console release.

game.name: 717 - Pinball Fantasies (USA)
game.info: This is a patch that automatically saves your Pinball Fantasies high scores to SRAM so you don’t have to use savestates to keep your records intact between games. You can also hold Select on startup to erase your previously saved scores.

game.name: 719 - Pinball Dreams (USA)
game.info: This is a patch that automatically saves your Pinball Dreams high scores to SRAM so you don’t have to use savestates to keep your records intact between games. You can also hold Select on startup to erase your previously saved scores.

game.name: 737 - Super Soccer (USA)
game.info: Super Soccer Euro edition is a hack which changes the 16 teams, as well as the stats, as you see Serbia’s. Even the player’s stats are changed, to suit. You can play as the mighty Spain down to the low ranked Luxembourg.

game.name: 74 - Secret of Mana (USA)
game.info: This ROM hack enhances the color of all three playable characters and two of the weapons.

game.name: 742 - Super Metroid (Japan, USA) (En,Ja)
game.info: A complete hack that artfully combines the essences of both Super Metroid and Metroid Zero Mission. A lot of ASM modifications were utilized in order to freshen up the gameplay considerably. Only the standard abilities of Samus are required to play this hack, but players adept with advanced techniques will find ample opportunity to use them. This hack, made by a Metroid hacker from Japan, is turning the heads of numerous Metroid hackers from the english-speaking world. Find it here.

game.name: 744 - Space Megaforce (USA)
game.info: These patches restore an in-game music track from the Japanese version which was taken out of the US/EU versions to avoid copyright infringement, due to borrowing heavily from several songs by the band New Order. The patch also updates the sound test menu to match.

game.name: 764 - Super Mario RPG - Legend of the Seven Stars (USA)
game.description: Super Mario RPG - Legend of the Seven Stars (USA)
game.info: Approx. hack length: 30 minutes.

patch.name: Super Mario RPG - Legend of the Seven Stars (USA).ips

rom.name: Super Mario RPG - Legend of the Seven Stars (USA).sfc

game.name: 792 - Final Fantasy III (USA)
game.info: This hack enables 5-digit, 10,000+ damage/healing. It’s capped at 32000 because the total is stored in a 16-bit, signed integer, creating a possible range of -32768 to 32767. I rounded it off to (-)32000 for aesthetic reasons.

game.name: 794 - Final Fantasy III (USA)
game.info: A rewritten script, some gameplay adjustments in the endgame, uncensored graphics, and a smattering of bugfixes found here and elsewhere. Stand Guard is my attempt at creating the definitive FF6 experience. I hope you enjoy it.

game.name: 806 - Final Fantasy III (USA)
game.info: This is a ’save anywhere’ hack for the SNES version Final Fantasy VI/III which I created based on the PAR code. I did this hack so that I could use it on a flash cart without cheating ability.

game.name: 812 - Super Metroid (Japan, USA) (En,Ja)
game.info: For fans of Metroid Super Zero Mission and fans of hard-type hacks is the latest update to Metroid Super Zero Mission. Version 2.2 plus Hard Edition. You can play the most up-to-date standard version of the hack or you can play the special Hard Edition if you want more challenge. The screenshots reveal that the Hard Edition is heavily modified from the standard version of the hack.

game.name: 814 - Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack)
game.description: Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack)
game.info: This game, which you might think of as EarthBound for girls, is a project that took several years and a lot of work with JHack and Hex Workshop to complete. Most of what I’ve changed is character names and the text, although I’ve also thrown in a few changes in the graphics I hope you’ll find to your liking. There is no “adult” content in this game unless you count a few items I’ve de-censored from Mother 2 that might get a mention on an Internet Movie Data Base parental guide but wouldn’t earn any movie so much as a PG rating (i.e. references to dating, death, and drugs).

patch.name: Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack).ips

rom.name: Earth Bound - New Controls 1.0 by Herringway (Hack).smc

game.name: 824 - Final Fantasy III (USA)
game.info: With months upon months of hacking, tweaking and even a small amount of spriting, Zeemis proudly presents the FFIV: The After Years tileset for FF6. This tileset overwrites the existing tileset if you choose to apply the patch. I used Yousei’s SNESPal and YY-CHR to make this happen. I even used FF6LE to fix tile collisions and any form of a tile anomaly so that if you’re not a hacker, you can still experience this patch by playing through a normal play through. This is only for the World of Balance, it does not affect the World of Ruin at all.

game.name: 84 - Seiken Densetsu 3 (Japan)
game.info: Seiken Densetsu 3 is often referred to as Secret of Mana 2, even if the name is not technically correct. The only version of the game with a “Secret of Mana 2″ titlescreen was in German; this patch uses the image from that translation.

game.name: 850 - Final Fantasy II (USA) (Rev 1)
game.info: This hack alters events of the game such that Golbez joins the party after Cecil and friends destroy the Giant of Babil. The story has been tweaked so that this development makes sense in context. Edge is demoted to a non-playable character in order to make room for Golbez.

game.name: 864 - Seiken Densetsu 3 (Japan)
game.info: Change symbols of pubs and inns in the US, German and Japan version.

game.name: 887 - Super Mario World (USA)
game.info: Welcome to the strange, lonely world of Massimo.

game.name: 893 - Donkey Kong Country (USA)
game.info: The first full Donkey Kong Country ROM hack! Explore an all new world of Kremling Khaos! Created using Simion32’s DKC Resource Editor.

game.name: 900 - Mega Man X (USA) (Rev 1)
game.info: This hack adds a debug type menu accessed by pressing L+X+A. It allows you to play with the map editor feature hidden in the game as well as some other features like unlocking scrolling bounds and toggling armor upgrades on/off instantly. Could by useful to anyone working on their own custom levels, or anyone just looking to play around.

game.name: 907 - Shin Megami Tensei (Japan)
game.info: This is a quick hack for Shin Megami Tensei that lets you access the automap using the L/R buttons rather than having to open the COMP menu every time you want to see where you are (similarly to how it works in SMT2.)

game.name: 919 - Wizardry I-II-III - Story of Llylgamyn (Japan) (En,Ja) (NP)
game.info: This mod aims to enhance the gameplay of all three games in Wizardry’s first trilogy. They were already hard enough, and required quite a bit of dedication to get anywhere. On top of that, they seemed to have a couple of rules that seemed arbitrarily handicapping to the player. In creating this mod I hope I have smoothed out some of the rough edges of this game, in order to make it more accessible.

game.name: 921 - Shaq-Fu (USA)
game.info: Ever wonder what Shaq Fu would have been like if it had been better? Of course you didn’t; you were smart enough to play one of the many, many better fighting games on the Super NES. You didn’t ask for it, but here’s your chance to play the game with a script that spends less time kissing Shaq’s butt and more time being entertaining.

game.name: 956 - Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA)
game.description: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA)
game.info: Parallel Remodel is a remodeled version of the famous Zelda3 hack Parallel Worlds, that we all know as an extremely difficult game. Parallel Worlds is altogether a great technological marvel, with new gfx, various asm patches, completely new overworld and dungeons etc. It has the potential of being even better than Alttp, but the gameplay is somewhat too radical. The backtracking was (in not so rare occasions) escalated to the extreme, the same goes for the health of some enemies. Some intellectual problems in the dark world dungeons are algorithm marvels: sure this is a good thing for math (Euclid really fits his nickname), but this is not a good thing for the player, who can easily give up.

patch.name: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA).ips

rom.name: Legend of Zelda, The - A Link to the Past (USA).sfc

game.name: 957 - Final Fantasy V (Japan)
game.info: This hack implements Lufia 2’s Ancient Cave on top of Final Fantasy V. Use one of the saves on the included SRAM to gain access to it. This hack is currently completely in Japanese but an English translation is in the works.

game.name: 984 - Super Robot Taisen EX (Japan)
game.info: This is the first hard mode patch for Super Robot Wars EX, as well as for the SRW series.

game.name: 990 - Super Mario Kart (USA)
game.info: My second complete replacement of all of the tracks in Super Mario Kart. The intent is to maintain the same feel as the original with a fresh set of races.
